name: Get a COVID-19 Vaccine for a Shot at Padres Tickets
description: San Diegans who get vaccinated against COVID-19 can get a shot at winning a pair of tickets to attend a Padres game.

affiliation.name: County of San Diego Communications Office

articleContent:
San Diegans who get vaccinated against COVID-19 can get a shot at winning a pair of tickets to attend a Padres game.
The County is teaming up with the baseball team to award 100 pairs of tickets to San Diegans. For a chance to win, you need to get vaccinated at a designated County mobile vaccination site June 3 through the end of June.
You can identify the clinics at coronavirus-sd.com/vaccine by the baseball logo next to the event and by following the County on social media.
Vaccines will also be provided to the public and Padres fans at Gallagher Square, formerly known as Park at the Park, on June 12 and June 26. People can sign up for the ticket drawing during the 15-minute wait period after vaccinated.
Ticket drawings will occur weekly. Winners will have the option to attend a Padres game in July or August.
San Diegans who get vaccinated before June 15 will also get a $50 gift card and an opportunity to win other prizes from state drawings taking place June 4, 11 and 15. Visit the state’s Vax for the Win for complete details.
County Expected to Move to Yellow Tier
The County is expected to have a case rate of less than two cases per 100,000 people for two consecutive weeks. Doing so would allow it to move into the Yellow Tier for activities June 9, one week before the state’s tier system is retired.
When the tier change goes into effect additional restrictions will be lifted. Here’s a complete list of activities allowed under the Yellow Tier.
A teenager gets vaccinated the San Diego State University clinic.
Vaccination Progress:

Doses delivered: Nearly 4.1 million.
Doses administered: Close to 3.7 million.
Received at least one shot: Over 1.95 million or 69.7% of San Diegans 12 and older.
Fully vaccinated: More than 1.54 million or 55.1%.
The goal: fully vaccinate 75% of San Diego County residents 12 and older or 2,101,936 people.
To date, 92.9% of the goal population has received at least one vaccine and 73.5% are fully vaccinated.
More vaccination information can be found coronavirus-sd.com/vaccine.

State Metrics:

San Diego County’s state-calculated, adjusted case rate is currently 1.7 cases per 100,000 residents, placing the County in the Yellow Tier for one week.
The County needs to have two weeks with a case rate of less than two cases per 100,000 residents to fully move into the Yellow Tier.
The testing positivity percentage is 1.3% and the County is in the Yellow Tier.
The health equity metric is 1.5%, placing the County in the Yellow Tier.
CDPH assesses counties on a weekly basis. The next report is scheduled for Tuesday, June 8.

Community Setting Outbreaks:

Two new community outbreaks were confirmed June 1 in restaurant/bar settings.
In the past seven days (May 26 through June 1), 11 community outbreaks were confirmed.
The community outbreaks trigger is seven or more in seven days.

Testing:

6,305 tests were reported to the County on June 1, and the percentage of new positive cases was 0.7%.
The 14-day rolling average percentage of positive cases is 0.7%. Target is less than 8.0%.
The 7-day, daily average of tests is 8,700.

Cases, Hospitalizations and ICU Admissions:

42 COVID-19 cases were reported to the County on June 1. The region’s total is now 280,346.
15,412 or 5.5% of all cases have required hospitalization.
1,706 or 0.6% of all cases and 11.1% of hospitalized cases had to be admitted to an intensive care unit.

Deaths:

Four new deaths were reported June 1. The region’s total is 3,760.
Three men in their 60s with underlying medical conditions died on May 29 and one man in his 30s with no existing medical conditions died May 31.

More Information:
The more detailed data summaries found on the County’s coronavirus-sd.com website are updated around 5 p.m. daily.
